thread.title: KU reports death of hoops great Bill Bridges, 76
thread.title_full: KU reports death of hoops great Bill Bridges, 76

author: The Capital-Journal
title: KU reports death of hoops great Bill Bridges, 76
text:
KU reports death of hoops great Bill Bridges, 76 Forward was a rebounding machine for Jayhawks, 4 NBA teams Posted: October 9, 2015 - 11:12am By The Capital-Journal 
Bill Bridges, who earned All-America honors at Kansas after averaging 16 points and 14 rebounds for the Jayhawks in 1961, died Sept. 25 in Santa Monica, Calif., after a long battle with cancer, KU officials reported Thursday. He was 76. 
Bridges, whose No. 32 KU jersey was retired in a 2004 ceremony in Allen Fieldhouse, won all-conference honors in the Big Eight during all three seasons he played for the Jayhawks from 1959-61. 
A 6-foot-6 power forward from Hobbs, N.M., Bridges grabbed 1,000 rebounds in 78 collegiate games, a 13.9 rebound average that ranks second on the KU career charts behind only Wilt Chamberlain's career average of 18.3. Bridges' 14.1 rebound average in 1961 remains No. 3 on KU's single-season records. 
After leaving KU, Bridges was taken by the Chicago Packers – now the Washington Wizards – as the 32nd overall selection in the 1961 NBA draft. He played one season for the Kansas City Steers in the American Basketball League before beginning a 12-season NBA career that saw him play for the St. Louis/Atlanta Hawks, Philadelphia 76ers, Los Angeles Lakers and Golden State Warriors. He won an NBA championship with the Warriors in 1975 and was a three-time NBA all-star in 1967, ' 68 and '70.
